item.title: Windows Is Lying To You… With DPI Virtualization

item.title: From A Hog To Just A Pig With A Simple Windows API Call

item.title: Don’t Be So Hard On Yourself (or, ShellExecute() to the Rescue!)
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
I’ve got a bad habit of always trying to reinvent the wheel, even when I’ve got a perfectly good wheel right in front of me. I just wrapped up some work on a Visual FoxPro app that uses a lot of rich-text format (RTF) files, and I was hitting a brick wall when it came to printing […]

The post Don’t Be So Hard On Yourself (or, ShellExecute() to the Rescue!) appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: Creating a “Fading” Form
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
I love the Desktop Alerts in Outlook 2003. They provide useful information without interfering with my work. I can’t stand to be working on one thing and suddenly have a MESSAGEBOX appear from another app informing me that it just did something wonderful on my behalf. The Desktop Alerts simply “appear” on my screen for a few […]

The post Creating a “Fading” Form appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.
